article.headline: Portland State 80, Cal Poly 63
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Will Funn scored 18 points and dished out six assists to lead Portland State to an 80-63 win over Cal Poly-San Luis Obispo on Saturday. Seamus Boxley added 17 points and 10 rebounds for the Vikings (1-2) while Jake Schroeder and Blake Walker each had 11 points. Vladimir Lisinac led Cal Poly (0-2) with 19 points. Glenn Jones added 12 points for the Mustangs. Cal Poly struggled offensively throughout the game, shooting 35 percent from the field and compiling only six assists. Portland State shot 44 percent from the field and connected on a season-high 75 percent from the free-throw line. Cal Poly grabbed an early 4-0 lead, but the Vikings came back with a 10-0 run to take a 10-4 advantage with 15:10 left in the first half. Tyler Hollist hit a 3-pointer with 3:04 left in the first half to break a 25-25 tie and give the Vikings a lead that they would not relinquish. The Vikings outscored the Mustangs 9-4 to start the second half and Cal Poly never threatened again.
